intro: Meniscium lanceum, commonly known as the lanceleaf meniscium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and forest margins. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
